Description: Limestone ostracon: on the recto twenty-one lines of a duplicate text of the 'Teaching of Amenemhat', 1a-8d, now in many places almost illegible. On the verso faded remains of several lines of a text of unknown character.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: S. Birch, 'Inscriptions in the Hieratic and Demotic Character from the Collections of the British Museum' (London, 1868), pl X; W. Helck, ‘Der text der "Lehre Amenemhets I. für seinen Sohn"’, ‘Kleine ägyptische Texte’ (Weisbaden, 1969), pp. I-57. Published: F. Adrom, Die Lehre des Amenemhet (BAe 19, 2006). The text of Amenemhat is available on T.L.A. (http://aaew.bbaw.de/tla/). Translation of Amenemhat: Parkinson, The Tale of Sinuhe and other Ancient Egyptian Poems 1940-1640 BC (Oxford World's Classics 1999), 203-11.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136348) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136348)
